intro: Neea laxa, commonly known as the slender neee, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ericaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in countries like Thailand, Vietnam, and Malaysia. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and arranged alternately along the stems. The flowers are small, white or pale pink, and clustered in umbels, adding ornamental value to the plant.
